objectDesc.p: Papyrus, 6.6x6.8, 1 extant leaf(s), 1 column(s), 4 line(s) per column, 30-34 characters per line, written in Greek.

additions.p: The verso contains a writing excersice.

history.provenance: Excavated 1922 by Petrie at Al Bahnasā, Miṣr from a garbage dump.
Transferred to University College London, Petrie Museum of Egyptian Archaeology at London, England.

msIdentifier.msName: UC32070, University College London, Petrie Museum of Egyptian Archaeology, London, England.

sourceDesc.bibl: Wayment, Thomas A., “A Christian Amulet Containing Colossians 3:9-10”, Vigiliae Christianae, vol. 39, no. 5, p. 528-533, Brill Academic Publishers: Leiden, Nederland, 2015. OCLC 1640835.
